subject: Re: [junit] Anyway to dynamically change name of test passed   to formatter?
msgSnippet: ... RIGHT RIGHT RIGHT... this is key. I forgot about that. ... These parts are key. Thanks Vladimir. That s what happens when I type code directly into my
messageBody:
>So said Vladimir R. Bossicard on 2003-06-01 --------------------
>> ParameterizedTestCase(param1, param2, ...) {
>> super(makeSuiteName(param1, param2, ...));
>> this.param1 = param1;
>> ...
>> }
>
>I'm only 99% certain, but the argument passed to the TestCase
>constructor MUST be the name of the method that will be executed and
>nothing else. If you pass an invalid name, the only solution to make it
>work is to overwrite runTest. But in this situation, it's overkilling.

RIGHT RIGHT RIGHT... this is key. I forgot about that.
>
>I reiterate my suggestion (in case it wasn't clear):
>
>ParameterizedTestCase(param1, param2, ...) {
> super("execute");
> this.param1 = param1;
> ...
>}
>
>public void execute() {
> ... the test method ...
>}
>
>public String getName() {
> return makeSuiteName(param1, param2, ...);
>}

These parts are key. Thanks Vladimir. That's what happens when I type code directly into my e-mail client.


J. B. Rainsberger,
